items.title: Regularly $400 Samsung Music Frame speaker is down to a wildly low $128 today (68% off)
items.summary:
Today only, as part of its Deal Zone offers, B&H is offering Samsung’s LS60D Smart Music Frame speaker for $127.99 shipped. That’s a hefty $270 off a one-of-a-kind speaker that typically goes for $398 on Amazon. While Samsung itself has it marked down to $270 right now, today’s deal at B&H shaves off another $152, making it the best price we’ve seen. It comes in $2 under the previous all-time low we spotted back in April, so be sure to cash in after getting more details below.

items.title: Save $202 on commercial-grade cutting power with Greenworks’ 82V 16-inch cordless chainsaw at a new $198 low
items.summary:
Amazon is now offering the best price yet on the Greenworks 82V Commercial-Grade 16-inch Cordless Chainsaw with a 4.0Ah battery and dual-port rapid charger at $198.11 shipped. This newer model has only been on the market since February and ranges between $300 and $400 on average, with regular periods spent down at the former. While there have been a few discounts under that rate, we’ve recently seen it cascading down in price since late August, with the 50% markdown here cutting $202 off the tag for the best new price we have tracked.

Featuring a series of different full-grain leather color treatments, it has an all new metal lens preotector/mount that is seriously awesome looking. While these may not be the latest and greatest headphones just stepping into the market, you’ll be getting plenty of bang for your buck, complete with active noise cancellation. It’s been designed for long listening sessions, with detachable earcups and an ergonomic shape to combat ear fatigue – plus, you’ll get 40 hours of wireless audio with noise cancellation activated (60 hours in standard mode), with only a five-minute quick charge adding another four hours to the battery.

items.summary:
Whisker has several Litter-Robot bundles getting up to $150 discounts going right now, with the latest Litter-Robot 4 self-cleaning litter box getting a three-year warranty bundle at $699 shipped, which Amazon doesn’t match but offers alternative bundles. This bundle would normally cost you $799 at full price, which gives you the three-year protection at the same price that the solo unit with no warranty goes for, making it all the better of a deal. Many of the discounts we’ve seen since its release in November have been $50 to $75 markdowns, which ramped up to $100 during Memorial Day, Christmas, Black Friday, and most recently, Labor Day. This is another chance to score your own at the best price we have tracked, which I cannot say enough good things about in my hands-on review from November. Likewise, you can also find the predecessor Litter-Robot 3 Connect 3-year warranty bundle at its $599 low, while Amazon has a 1-year warranty deal at $549 – with a hands-on review available for this model, as well.

items.title: Lectric’s Endless Summer Sale offers $424 in FREE gear with the 60-mile XPress 750 commuter e-bikes at $1,299, more
items.summary:
Lectric has launched its Endless Summer Sale that is offering up to $720 in savings on its lineup of e-bike bundles, which includes the ongoing $500 price cut on the ONE Premium commuter e-bike. Among the group, we spotted a notably large bundle being given to Lectric’s XPress 750 Long-Range Commuter e-bikes that are getting $424 in FREE gear at $1,299 shipped, in both its step-thru and step-over designs. This package would normally run you $1,723 without the bundle savings, which beats out all the bundles we’ve seen before that only ever amounted up to $410 in gear. Along with the e-bike (which is one of my favorite commuters over the years), you’ll be getting a rear cargo rack, fenders to go over both tires, an Elite headlight upgrade, a suspension seat post, two adjustable rear-view mirrors, and an accordion-style folding bike lock. Head below for more on this e-bike’s capabilities and the other deals we’re seeing while the sale lasts.
